moves.1. d4 c5 2. d5 e5 3. e4: Played irreflexively. It is better to take e.p.
moves.3... d6 4. Nf3: I am completely out of my known lines, so I am prepared to suffer in the opening. I sense this move is not the most accurate.
moves.6... Ngf6 7. Qc2: I sensed it was better to defend it with the Q, and leave the N to be more flexible.
moves.7... Nf8 8. Be2 Ng6 9. g3: Preventing Nf4, but debilitating my castling pawns.
moves.9... Bd7 10. Nc3 Qc8: I overlooked the theat to h6, but I think it is not all that bad to let him take it.
moves.11. a4: To support a future N entry in b5, if ever Be7 moves... which is not likely to happen! I'm at a loss!
moves.11... Bxh3 12. Ng5 Bd7 13. f4: My king is wide open, but I can't allow myself into passivity. I have to create some play.
moves.13... exf4: I didn't want my dsb to be exchanged by the Ng6.
moves.14. gxf4: He gets g4, true, but is it really useful for him?
moves.14... h6 15. e5: Time to open up the game. I don't have time to get my K saved.
Now, a curious tactic situation happens. If black takes my B, he can't take anymore the N or RxR+.
moves.18... hxg5 19. Rxh8+ Nxh8 20. Nd5: I want to bring my Q to h7. In order to do that, I have to get rid of Nf6.
moves.20... Nxd5 21. Bxg5: I can't hope to recover all the material, and I don't want a B to be able to land in f8. (This whole plan has a flaw: can you see it?).
moves.21... Bxg5 22. Qh7: ...and I thought black had no escape from QxN# or Qg8#. But he has!
moves.22... Ng6 23. Qg8+ Nf8: Here, Qxg7 was the needed move in order to play Bh5 and go on with the attack. But I can't allow black a single move to activate, or to free his K position. If Qxg7 ...Qd8, Bh5 and black can play ...Qf6.
moves.25. Bh5: Just a tempo to bring Ra1 in, please... :-)
moves.25... Be6: ?? Thank you, black! g6, and I'm busted.
moves.26. Kf2: The needed tempo to bring the R in!!!!
